summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a phone interview with attorney Elizabeth Parker on behalf of her client Jessica Nicodemo. Nicodemo reported second-hand information from Tara Lordi, who worked as Glenn Straub's assistant, suggesting a wealthy Palm Beach businessman with a history of trouble involving underage girls had been a guest on Straub's yacht. Nicodemo believed this referred to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Elizabeth Parker
persons.context: Attorney who provided information to the FBI on behalf of her client, Jessica Nicodemo, during a phone interview on August 15, 2019.

persons.name: Jessica Nicodemo
persons.context: Client of attorney Elizabeth Parker who provided second-hand information about a guest on Glenn Straub's yacht, believed to be Jeffrey Epstein, based on a statement from Tara Lordi.

persons.name: Tara Lordi
persons.context: Worked as Glenn Straub's assistant and advised Jessica Nicodemo that a wealthy Palm Beach businessman with a history of trouble involving underage girls had been a guest on Straub's yacht.

persons.name: Glenn Straub
persons.context: Individual who owned a yacht on which Tara Lordi, his assistant, reported a guest was a wealthy Palm Beach businessman with a history involving underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wealthy businessman from Palm Beach with a history of legal trouble involving underage girls. Jessica Nicodemo believed the individual referenced by Tara Lordi was Epstein.

connections.description: Elizabeth Parker acted as the attorney for Jessica Nicodemo, providing information to the FBI on her behalf.
Tara Lordi worked as an assistant to Glenn Straub.
Tara Lordi advised Jessica Nicodemo about a guest on Glenn Straub's yacht.
Tara Lordi's statement suggested a wealthy Palm Beach businessman (believed by Nicodemo to be Epstein) had been a guest on Straub's yacht.

events.title: FBI Interview with Attorney Elizabeth Parker
events.description: Attorney Elizabeth Parker provided information to the FBI on behalf of her client Jessica Nicodemo regarding second-hand information about Jeffrey Epstein potentially being a guest on Glenn Straub's yacht.

keyFacts: Jessica Nicodemo, through her attorney Elizabeth Parker, provided second-hand information to the FBI on August 15, 2019.

The information originated from Tara Lordi, assistant to Glenn Straub, who stated a wealthy Palm Beach businessman with a history of trouble involving underage girls had been a guest on Straub's yacht.
Nicodemo believed the individual referenced by Lordi was Jeffrey Epstein, though she had no direct knowledge of Epstein being on the yacht.
The FBI investigation file number is 318B-NH-2050945-302.
